meanings.sent1: The scientist was fossilising the ancient bone for display.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the dinosaur bones fossilised in the ground.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy archaeologist ended up fossilising his own footprints in the mud.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were fossilising in her mind, becoming like ancient relics.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic ash quickly began fossilising the fallen leaves, preserving them for centuries.

meanings.sent1: The dinosaur bones fossilised over millions of years.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tree slowly fossilised in the swamp.
meanings.sent3: The curious child imagined fossilising into a rock and being discovered by future explorers.
meanings.sent4: The old shipwreck was slowly fossilising on the ocean floor.
meanings.sent5: The petrified wood was fossilising into a beautiful piece of art.

meanings.definition: To make or become antiquated or rigid.
meanings.sent1: The traditional values were fossilising in the modern society.
meanings.sent2: The once innovative technology was now fossilising in its outdated form.
meanings.sent3: The strict rules were fossilising the creativity of the students.
meanings.sent4: Her rigid mindset was fossilising her ability to adapt to new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The old traditions were fossilising the progress of the community.
